name: Salesforce
title: Agentforce at Scale

classification.classificationRationale: Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke: Agentforce platform serves as central AI hub, with spokes into support (50% AI-handled), sales (20%+ more AEs), and product. Structural orientation: distinct AI-driven workforce restructuring (9K→5K support staff) with centralized AI budget ($300M) and deterministic Agent Script controls. Confirmed by workforce recomposition pattern and enterprise-scale deployment (18,500 customers, 3B workflows/month).

description:
Salesforce has achieved what may be the largest enterprise deployment of agentic AI, with Agentforce serving 18,500 enterprise customers running more than 3 billion automated workflows monthly.
- Internal validation: deployed on help.salesforce.com, handled 2.6 million conversations, now resolves 63% of questions autonomously
- Customer satisfaction scores roughly match human agents
- Enterprise results: Reddit (46% case deflection, 84% reduction in resolution times), Adecco (51% conversations outside working hours)
- Engine: Anticipating $2M savings, CSAT improved from 3.7 to 4.3
- WEF deployment (January 2026): 'EVA' proactive concierge for 3,000+ leaders at Davos

observableMarkers.metrics: 18,500 enterprise customers (up from 12,500). 3B automated workflows monthly. Agentic product revenue: $540M ARR.

mechanisms.name: Hire CAIOs from Consumer Tech
mechanisms.evidence: Eric Hysen hired as Chief AI & Transformation Officer from US government (DHS CAIO/CIO). Career path: Google SWE/PM → Biden-Harris transition → DHS CAIO/CIO → Salesforce. Government-to-corporate CAIO pipeline.

layers.label: Dual AI Leadership — Chief AI & Transformation Officer
layers.summary: Salesforce added Eric Hysen as Chief AI and Transformation Officer (Aug 2025), reporting to President/Chief Legal Officer. Scope: legal, government, compliance, public affairs, and 'trusted agentics.' Background: Former CAIO at DHS, former CIO at DHS, Google SWE/PM. Government-to-corporate CAIO pipeline. This creates dual AI leadership: product AI teams (Agentforce) + internal AI transformation officer (Hysen).

layers.label: AI-Driven Workforce Restructuring
layers.summary: Cut support staff from 9,000 to ~5,000 through AI agent deployment. 50% of customer conversations now AI-handled (from zero one year prior). Shifted hiring mix: 20%+ more AEs, flat engineering. Budget tripled $4M→$300M. Agentforce recalibrated with deterministic 'Agent Script' controls. In 'Agent War' with ServiceNow for enterprise AI OS dominance.

openQuestions: What is the actual composition of the remaining 5,000 support staff? Are they supervising AI or handling escalations?
How was the transition managed operationally? Over what timeframe?
Has the Klarna reversal influenced Salesforce's approach?
taxonomyFeedback: Salesforce's simultaneous workforce cuts (4,000 support staff) and hiring shifts (+20% AEs) represents a distinct pattern: AI doesn't just reduce headcount, it reshapes the workforce composition. The taxonomy doesn't capture this 'workforce recomposition' pattern.
Benioff's contradiction (publicly downplaying AI job displacement 2 months before cutting 4,000 jobs) raises questions about how executives manage the narrative around AI-driven restructuring.
